org.opengrok.indexer.authorization

Class AuthorizationFramework

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opengrok.indexer.framework.PluginFramework<IAuthorizationPlugin>
      • org.opengrok.indexer.authorization.AuthorizationFramework

  • public final class AuthorizationFramework
extends PluginFramework<IAuthorizationPlugin>
    Placeholder for performing authorization checks.
    Author:
    Krystof Tulinger

      • getStack

        public AuthorizationStack getStack()
        Get available plugins.

        This method and couple of following methods use locking because

        1. plugins can be reloaded at anytime
        2. requests are pretty asynchronous

        So this tries to ensure that there will be no ConcurrentModificationException or other similar exceptions.

        Returns:
        the stack containing plugins/other stacks

      • setStack

        public void setStack(AuthorizationStack s)
        Set new value of the authorization stack. This will come into effect only after reload() is called.
        Parameters:
        s - new stack to be used

      • addPlugin

        public void addPlugin(AuthorizationStack stack,
                      IAuthorizationPlugin plugin)
        Add a plug-in into the plug-in stack. This has the same effect as invoking addPlugin(stack, IAuthorizationPlugin, REQUIRED).
        Parameters:
        stack - the stack
        plugin - the authorization plug-in

      • addPlugin

        public void addPlugin(AuthorizationStack stack,
                      IAuthorizationPlugin plugin,
                      AuthControlFlag flag)
        Add a plug-in into the plug-in array.

        Configured plugin

        For plug-in that has an entry in configuration, the new plug-in is put in the place respecting the user-defined order of execution.

        New plugin

        If there is no entry in configuration for this class, the plugin is appended to the end of the plugin stack with flag flag

        The plug-in's load method is NOT invoked at this point

        This has the same effect as invoking addPlugin(new AuthorizationEntity(stack, flag, getClassName(plugin), plugin).

        Parameters:
        stack - the stack
        plugin - the authorization plug-in
        flag - the flag for the new plug-in

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
        Remove and unload all plugins from the stack.
        See Also:
        AuthorizationEntity.unload()

      • loadAllPlugins

        public void loadAllPlugins(AuthorizationStack stack)
        Load all plugins in the stack. If any plugin has not been loaded yet it is marked as failed.
        Parameters:
        stack - the stack

      • unloadAllPlugins

        public void unloadAllPlugins(AuthorizationStack stack)
        Unload all plugins in the stack
        Parameters:

      • afterReload

        protected void afterReload()
        Calling this function forces the framework to reload its stack.

        Plugins are taken from the pluginDirectory.

        Old instances in stack are removed and new list of stack is constructed. Unload and load event is fired on each plugin.

        This method is thread safe with respect to the currently running authorization checks.

        Specified by:
        afterReload in class PluginFramework<IAuthorizationPlugin>
        See Also:
        IAuthorizationPlugin.load(java.util.Map), IAuthorizationPlugin.unload(), Configuration.getPluginDirectory()
